website_summaries.verdict: A fast-working probiotic supplement that many dogs tolerate well and is easy to give them sprinkled over food.
pros: Owners report good results, with dogs’ digestive issues usually clearing up with regular use
A few reports of product helping “tear streaks” from dogs’ eyes
Can be used after treatment with Flagyl or other antibiotics
cons: As with any probiotic, doesn’t always work
Price point is high, and some feel the packets should have more product in them
Some dogs turn their noses up when product is sprinkled over their food

customer_reviews.title: The product works! It's helped our twelve year-old golden for the last three years.
customer_reviews.text: We've been having "gastronomic" issues with our golden. Our vet recommend FortiFlora and ever since we've been using it (about three years), our golden has not had any episodes. We just put one sachet in Bear's food every morning and that's all there is to it. Thank goodness for FortiFlora because we tried everything else for the poor guy. This product really worked for our dog. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: schackbo

customer_reviews.title: Packets not filled adequately
customer_reviews.text: I've been buying these packets on a regular basis and this is the first time I bought them in bulk. The packets barely contained anything. Due to the high cost of this item, I split one package between both dogs, These packs contained less than half of the usual amount
customer_reviews.author: Napagal

customer_reviews.title: Our dog loves it and it's good for her!
customer_reviews.text: Our vet recommended giving this to our 3 year old king charles cavalier after she had some problems with her pancreas and digestive system. She was also put on digestive care food and she is not allowed treats. When her problems subsided, we stopped giving her this. However, it seemed that her digestive system did better on it. So with her vet's opinion, she's been on it for over a year and probably will stay on it forever. It seems to keep her system smooth and plus, she loves the taste and getting some "gravy" on her dinner every night!
customer_reviews.author: Jordan C.

customer_reviews.title: Expiring in 6 months - Review is more about the seller
customer_reviews.text: This review is more about the seller. Received a 3 pack which are expiring in 6 months (See attached pic). Went to a local store, paid more $ for 1 pack but it had an expiration date in 13 months. We like the product a lot as it helps regulate our 13 lbs, 4 yr old Shih Tzu's tummy. We use half a packet (Each box has 30 packets so 90 packets will need 180 days) so they would expire even if we miss a day 🙄 Maybe that's why it's cheaper
customer_reviews.author: Jag

customer_reviews.title: Done!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second occurance the shipping of my subscribe and save has been delayed. When you use and require this daily fir your dogs health it makes you wonder why not just place the order without subscribe and save!! I’m done with subscribe and save!
customer_reviews.author: Patti

customer_reviews.title: Not for Animal Lovers
customer_reviews.text: First ingredient is ground up animal entrails. Dog entrails presumably. Horrors!!!! Not for Animal Lovers. The same strains of probiotics are available from non animal sources.
customer_reviews.author: P. Hughes

customer_reviews.title: Acute over chronic issues
customer_reviews.text: For acute episodes of diarrhea, this product is a must. Especially when taking an antibiotic such as Metronidazole (Flagyl). There is evidence to show diarrhea is shortened even further when taking simultaneously with antibiotics. For routine use, pro-biotics are so so. There is mixed evidence for their effectiveness. Unfortunately pro-biotics have a limited effect on gut flora, lasting approximately two weeks. I wish they worked better for long term management of chronic GI issues, but that is no fault of Fortiflora, just simply a limitation that is important to understand. Acute issues, fantastic. Chronic issues, leaves much to be desired.
customer_reviews.author: Nurse Dean

customer_reviews.title: No More Diarrhea
customer_reviews.text: My dog had diarrhea with every stool. Did not know what to do until my vet put her on Fortiflora. The very next day, and every day since then, her stool has been of normal consistency. Great stuff! Would suggest to anyone who has a dog with digestive problems. They also have it for cats but I can't comment since I don't have a cat but I would guess it would work well for them as well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So much cheaper than at the Vet's!
customer_reviews.text: I can't even remember what the vet charged me for one box when first saying my dog's should go on this but what I do know was it was criminal versus buying it outside of the practice. Purina's formula really seems to work well with my dogs and they've each loved it in their food. Happy to keep them on it!
customer_reviews.author: Chaotic Cate

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product! My pup had surgery at 3 months and had half his small intestines removed. He's his happy and healthy now, but we were told he would probably have chronic diarrhea due to the surgery. These probiotics worked amazingly well. No diarrhea for my pup, his stools are soft to normal.
customer_reviews.author: Cruzer

customer_reviews.title: This Product Works
customer_reviews.text: We own a purebred black lab that can't keep things out of his mouth and into his gut. We've had our moments with his stomach and digestion issues. At points in time, vet visits had become pretty common. We've found that adding flora to his diet everyday is just what he needs to stay regular. While the individual pouches aren't what you call cheap, it is a lifesaver for us and certainly keeps his vet bill down and his whole digestive system in check. We buy the product now in large amounts as its part of his regular diet. Love the product!
customer_reviews.author: G Money

customer_reviews.title: Great product but bad batch
customer_reviews.text: I love this stuff for my ME dog. However this batch had large coagulated prices and was not powder like it should be. I am not sure how that could have happened.
customer_reviews.author: SNDYGRL

customer_reviews.title: Could not be happier!
customer_reviews.text: In the Fall, our German Shepherd started having loose stools. Tests showed that he was free of parasites and his labs were normal. On a hunch, our veterinarian recommended this product and we saw almost immediate relief. When our fist box ran out, his symptoms returned within a couple of days. Thankfully, our next order arrived and we could resume using FortiFlora quickly. Once again, his system responded favorably and we've had no further issues. By the way, we give him one half packet in the morning and the other half at night with his meals.
customer_reviews.author: HA

customer_reviews.title: Works wonders for our Doberman
customer_reviews.text: We have a ten year old Doberman who has had irritable bowel syndrome that can be induced by stress for the past few years. There were nights where she was incredibly uncomfortable, and we had to take her out every hour or so overnight because of horrible diarrhea, so none of us were getting any sleep. After many tests ruling out any other illness, our vet recommended this probiotic. Since we started her on this a year ago, she has never had a night without sleep due to discomfort. This has been a miracle supplement for her particular situation, and we couldn't be happier with the results.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffreyw

customer_reviews.title: FortiFlora is Worth the Cost
customer_reviews.text: I have used FortiFlora for a good amount of time. On my previous dog who had eating issues, the first time I used it she kept licking the bowl and from thereon she would sit there until she was fed. The FortiFlora definitely made a difference in her life. Our current dog is given FortiFlora as a probiotic and loves the taste. The FortiFlora has been recommended by our vets and is extremely expensive. While it is still expensive through Amazon, I feel it is definitely worth it and the pricing is so much better.
customer_reviews.author: Spirit

customer_reviews.title: Very helpful product and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Works great to help keep my older dog from having tummy trouble. For a small dog, I sprinkle 1/2 packet on AM and PM food with a splash of water since it is a dry powder. She likes the taste. A bit costly, but worth every penny to not have vomit or diarrhea issues with your pups. My vet recommended this product. My pet has been on this for approx 4 years.
customer_reviews.author: Kaycee

customer_reviews.title: Keeps my dogs from getting diarrhea but expensive
customer_reviews.text: My vet gave me this when my dogs got diarrhea repeatedly. As long as I sprinkle a packet on their food once a day, they do really well and they love the flavor. It is expensive but worth it to keep the diarrhea away.
customer_reviews.author: dogmom

customer_reviews.title: Helps my dogs digestion
customer_reviews.text: Two of my dogs get a daily dose mixed into soft food once a day. My third dog is limited to dry kibble, so I put a small scoop of her Kibble into a small container, sprinkle the dose on the Kibble, and snap on the lid. Giving the container a few shakes coats the Kibble with the dose and she gobbles it right up.
customer_reviews.author: LeonaBelle

customer_reviews.title: Keep your dog healthy!
customer_reviews.text: I had my little dog get HGE, and this has kept her healthy so far (there is no certain determination of what causes HGE, but treatment is both probiotics mixed with a lot of antibiotics to kill the bad bacteria which accumulates in the intestines and causes the hemorrhaging). I will be buying this for her the rest of her life, unless I find a dog food which already has probiotics built in that I trust.
customer_reviews.author: Tara Fox Hall

customer_reviews.title: Great for gastro issues and grass eaters!
customer_reviews.text: One of our dogs is healthy as a horse and the other has more frequent tummy issues and occasional soft stool. She doesn't eat random things or table scraps, only her regular dog food. We started adding Fortiflora to her morning meal and it's helped her tremendously. It's a probiotic that helps keep the bacteria in their stomachs balanced, and her instances of tummy issues have decreased since we started using it daily. She used to occasionally eat grass to make herself vomit when she wasn't feeling well, but she's totally stopped eating grass since we started her on Fortiflora!
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: It works and the dog likes the taste.
customer_reviews.text: My order just arrived and the expiration date on the boxes is December 2019, which is 6 months from now. Last time I bought these from another source, the expiration date was one year away. It's ok, but I may not use all 3 boxes in 6 months, would have preferred fresher boxes.
customer_reviews.author: slz

customer_reviews.title: Great probiotic!
customer_reviews.text: I use this probiotic for my elderly dog daily. She is a picky eater, but actually seems to like the flavor of this! I simply pour it over her canned food and mix it in. This has made a world of difference in firming up her stools. I was skeptical, but this is a wonderful product!!
customer_reviews.author: Corinne

customer_reviews.title: The produce itself is very good. I was not pleased
customer_reviews.text: My Westie has been taking FortiFlora for a couple of years now which has helped with her digestive disorders. The produce itself is very good. I was not pleased, however, when I received this order through Amazon and the expiration date on all three boxes that I purchased was March 2016. Effectively, that meant that I received out-dated products. The only reason I did not return it is I don't feel there is really any harmful effect in using them through the expiration date. I will be seeking an alternative source for my next order though.
customer_reviews.author: Connie T. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Solved a runny poop problem
customer_reviews.text: My dog is taking trilostane, which gives him runny poop. This probiotic solves the problem and has returned him to normal, medium firm poop. If your dog has consistently runny poop, this should help. By the way, my dog really likes the flavoring in this too.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos

customer_reviews.title: Best stuff on the market for your doggies!!
customer_reviews.text: I discovered Forti Flora when my little French Bully was having some severe gassy issues. I mean horrible gas issues. I told my vet and we tried Ellie on different food. That didn't help. Another food, that didn't help. She suggested FortiFlora and wouldn't you know within a week this horrible smelling gassy little girl, was no longer FARTING!!! It was actually incredible. I discovered that its much cheaper buying it through Purina on Amazon than through the vet and that adds up quickly. But, the shipping is extra quick, usually free and you can't beat the price. I would recommend to anyone's poor little "gassy" little friend....lolol CONS: NONE!!
customer_reviews.author: FrenchPugs

customer_reviews.title: Function
customer_reviews.text: I give this to my 8 yr old terrier for a probiotic supplement. It was also recommended by my vet. She’s been on this for 2 yrs now & seems to be more active since she’s been on it
customer_reviews.author: Roxie

customer_reviews.title: pretty happy with it
customer_reviews.text: I use this on vet recommendation for my maltipoo, who is prone to pancreatitis and other GI problems. So far, pretty happy with it. Have been using it nightly for a year. My dog won't eat it when it's sprinkled on his food, so I mix it with a little water instead and he seems convinced it's a doggy milkshake. He LOVES it. Only time he won't drink it is when he's sick. Four stars not five because I'm not convinced the fortiflora is really helping his GI stuff (rather than his prescription food and rigid diet), but it was vet recommended and my dog loves it so I'm happy enough.
customer_reviews.author: glvr1

customer_reviews.title: My dog liked it
customer_reviews.text: My vet recommended I use this for my dog when he had diarrhea. He seemed to like it, but it didn't help with the diarrhea. We don't use it at the present time
customer_reviews.author: Wanda

customer_reviews.title: Works for our Weimaraner
customer_reviews.text: Our Vet recommended this for our Weimaraner (who is allergic to Corn and has a very sensitive stomach). We mix this with pure pumpkin puree once a day and it works great for her.
customer_reviews.author: Bear Indawoods

customer_reviews.title: COUNTERFEIT!
customer_reviews.text: ALERT! COUNTERFEIT! It clearly states on the seller's account that the country of origin is CHINA! This is a product made in the US! Don't feed this junk to your pets! Buy from US only.
customer_reviews.author: D. Gustafson

customer_reviews.title: Better Health for Dogs with Sensitive Stomachs
customer_reviews.text: I was purchasing the Fortiflora from the veterinarian who recommended it, thinking it was available by prescription only. I was paying almost $10 per box more than I bought it for in this 3-pack! I put one packet per day in my small dog's food and it has helped his digestion so much that it's really remarkable! It's a probiotic for dogs and it really works. He has always had a sensitive stomach and even with special formula prescription dog food, he was often sick with diarrhea or vomiting. He has fewer digestive upsets now and as a result, fewer visits to the vet!
customer_reviews.author: Alice S. Magrane

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: it really helps my dog. She gets horrible stomach aches. The vet told me to get this to her. It's great how much it works.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: My dog loves this probiotic
customer_reviews.text: Love this probiotic. I wish I could use it twice a day....my dog loves the taste and eats her food with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: E. Foster

customer_reviews.title: FortiFlora canine probiotic
customer_reviews.text: This is the brand our vet recommended. I initially got the first box from that office, albeit a bit expensive from them. But it did the trick for our dog's sensitive stomach. So we looked for it online and were happy to find it for a little less money. Once I pull a packet out, our dog can hardly wait to eat. She leans on my legs and pushes me hurry, which she never used to do. FortiFlora has a delicious beef scent. I cannot comment about the flavor, cuz the dog doesn't talk and I don't eat her food, but she and her stomach are much happier than they used to be.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: Life saver for my pup
customer_reviews.text: My dog started his first year with numerous problems included allergies to fish & chicken along with grand mal seizures from Frontline. All of these problems resulted in very loose stools which persisted even when the initial issues were remedied. He was chronically dehydrated and miserable that he had to go out so frequently. My vet recommended starting this and it worked almost immediately. He's 5 years old now and we continue to give him 1/2 pkt (20 llb dog) every morning to keep him regulated. It's not a med, really; it's a supplement so there's no harm in continuing. I would compare it to using Activia yogurt for humans.
customer_reviews.author: SCL616

customer_reviews.title: How much to keep your dog healthy and alive for a little longer?
customer_reviews.text: I am a grounded, skeptical guy that knows capitalists feed off the emotions of pet owners to sell snake oil and BS. This stuff seems legit, and it seems to have had a VERY positive impact on my 14 year old for the last 2 years. I don't think this is fake, new agey, BS... but it could be confirmation bias. I will say that the only supplemental product my vet has ever recommended is this probiotic.... they even say to stay away from others that are less reputable, etc. My dog loves it, and it seems to keep him healthy. So get it.
customer_reviews.author: Uncle Fishbits

customer_reviews.title: Healing my Westie
customer_reviews.text: We got a Westie puppy in September, 2012 and the little guy came home with Giardia, a parasite that affects the intestional track. I've been putting Forti Flora on his food once a day since then and he's almost normal. He was so little when he got this problem that I'm not sure his little intestional track was ever right. But now he's about normal, looks great, eats lots, loves to run and play and is perfectly normal. Not sure what I would have done without this product. I've used it before with my other dogs for tummy and bowel issues and it always does the trick.
customer_reviews.author: Randall Higgins

customer_reviews.title: Works wonders for the digestive system!
customer_reviews.text: My female rescue elkie, Anna is originally from a puppy mill and used to have a problem with vomiting if she didn't eat many smalls meals throughout the day. I decided to try Fortiflora, after trying another probiotic unsuccessfully, to help minimize this problem. This is a miracle product! She's been on Fortiflora for over a year and hasn't had a single incident of vomiting. It works wonders for her digestive system. Purchasing it from amazon ensures quick and reliable delivery, and a good price!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Anne Zilney

customer_reviews.title: Does what is says it will- good product!
customer_reviews.text: I use this product for my 5 year old boxer/hound/lab mixed breed dog. He suffers from mild digestive problems that are made even worse with his seasonal allergies. This product makes a noticeable difference in his stool quality as well as his general demeanor. While it isn't an inexpensive product, it is worth every penny. He doesn't seem to even notice, or perhaps just doesn't mind it, when It is sprinkled on top of his dry food. I use this product daily when I notice symptoms of his allergies and 3/4 times weekly the rest of the year. Overall, this product seems to improve my dogs general health.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron R

customer_reviews.title: Settled dog's tummy
customer_reviews.text: We have a collie that has, what I would call "irritable bowel syndrome", so we had accidents frequently (luckily, he sleeps in a heated garage!) We changed his food avoiding grain products and that helped a little. We had him checked for other allergies at a specialty vet office and they recommended a pro-biotic to help keep his tummy happier. It is working. We add this to his food every evening, and it's been 4 months since the last accident! We will continue giving this to him. The price was better, also, than buying it from the Vet office. I will continue buying this product.
customer_reviews.author: M. McCleary

customer_reviews.title: Quality product,  easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: It has helped keep my male Labrador "regular". We sprinkle it on his food and he seems to like the flavor.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Ellen

customer_reviews.title: fortiflora works great and fast
customer_reviews.text: this product was introduced by my veterinarian at first. I have been pleased with it and have since bought more via amazon. You will see significant results in your pets stools within 1 or 2 doses, which is one packet per day. This supplement has a lot of great things in it for any dog to benefit from,the pro-biotics and maintaining a normal GI tract and overall health. You can't go wrong with thid product. I have used other products on the market and am most pleased with this one. Doesn't matter the breed of your dog, as from my experience. It is equally as beneficial to small and large dog types.
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: Poor rabbits.
customer_reviews.text: I have been buying this for years for our Carolina Dog. She has a somewhat sensitive stomach and sometimes eats things she "hunts" from our fenced in yard. Poor rabbits....Anyway she eats things that she should not (my husband used to feed her pizza crusts) eat and ends up getting the runs. This stuff works like magic. I always keep a supply on hand. Sprinkle a little on her food and she is back to normal in no time. Keep making it Purina, please.
customer_reviews.author: just me i guess

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PRODUCT!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product! Have been using since our dog was 3 1/2 months...now 7 yrs. I usually get a tethers blood test, hoping to avoid an unessary vaccine , (I try to limit toxins), around 7 is considered normal...he's in the mid 300s. Great resistance to the illness he's suppose to be vaccinated for. I think his flora is excellent. As with adults a healthy colon is a large part of immune system. HE STILLS GET THE OTHER VACCINES HE NEEDS.
customer_reviews.author: Kath

customer_reviews.title: Usually good but low amounts in packets this time
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased this product in the past & have had no issues. This time it seems like many packets are practically empty or empty. Maybe there was something wrong with the production line for this box?
customer_reviews.author: Robin

customer_reviews.title: My dog's love this
customer_reviews.text: And it keeps them regular and healthy! Love this product!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: A good product
customer_reviews.text: I was dealing with 12 year old N male dog(golden/chow mix) sounds goofy, but a beautiful dog. He was having unexplained loose stools and a couple indoor accidents. Went to the vet with a stool sample which turned out negative for parasites and other things they check for. My vet thought it might be emanating from his gut, hence the probiotics. After one more indoor accident, he seemed to straighten out and for the last month or so he is like a new dog, Firm stools, playful and much more energy. So in a nutshell, this product helped us out immensely.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: My vet recommended this brand for my puppy who had runny poop. My dogs seem to love the smell and taste. Has also helped with his tummy problems
customer_reviews.author: Ronnette Williams

customer_reviews.title: Great for my dog's digestion
customer_reviews.text: My golden retriever loves this. For him, it is a special treat I put on his food daily. He had severe stomach issues and these definitely helped to get his intestines relief. It is safe and is a reliable product.
customer_reviews.author: B. Hochberg

customer_reviews.title: Excellent supplement for my husky mix
customer_reviews.text: My husky mix had very loose stools, practically diarrhea since he was a puppy. The vet recommended this probiotic and within about a week of giving this to him once per day his stools completely formed up!
customer_reviews.author: Kristina Stoural

customer_reviews.title: Canine FortiFlora--works for my dog!
customer_reviews.text: FortiFlora has really helped my Std. Pdl. with his intestinal issues. He was given to us by some people that couldn't afford to feed him and was so grossly underweight, the veterinarian couldn't vaccinate him due to not having enough body mass for the shots. I started him on FortiFlora and Taste of the Wild Salmon dry and canned and he's doubled his weight. I know other people that have had dogs with intestinal issues and that all stopped when they put their dogs on FortiFlora.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Hill

customer_reviews.title: Terrific product.
customer_reviews.text: Pricey but dogs love it. Also works great to mask the flavors of added medication when applied to dog food & kibble.
customer_reviews.author: Dee Gross

customer_reviews.title: This probiotic has settled his stomach so that his stools look like they should and the occasions of looseness are vastly ...
customer_reviews.text: Have a pup with a digestive system that "made in China" turkey jerky has compromised. This probiotic has settled his stomach so that his stools look like they should and the occasions of looseness are vastly diminished. He gets one packet a day on his evening meal and has never rejected because of taste. If I miss a day we are normally ok but two and problems reappear so I know the stuff works.
customer_reviews.author: 4-Chin Fancier

customer_reviews.title: Dog digestive Health
customer_reviews.text: My rescue Havanese (Eve) had colitis for 4 years until I put her on this FortiFlora. OMG, she got better! It took a few years to heal the long term inflammation, but she is now eleven and doesn't need at all anymore. I keep it around for my other dog, and use occasionally for loose bowels. Eve uses occasionally as well. It puts the good bacteria, that which is lost with upset stomachs. back into their digestive track. And, they love the taste. It's yummy in their food.
customer_reviews.author: Marge D.

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful probiotic
customer_reviews.text: I started giving this to my dog while he was undergoing chemotherapy due to the diarrhea and increase in passing gas he developed. He has since finished the chemo treatments and all antibiotic treatments and has continued to have regular, solid bowel movements and regardless of what he eats, hardly any stinky farts! He doesn't like the powder sprinkled on his food though; I have to dump the packet in a piece of roast beef and roll it up (which isn't an issue- my vet just said most dogs love it on their food). I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Alice

customer_reviews.title: Good for elderly dog who vomits and has diarrhea.
customer_reviews.text: My Labrador Retriever ( 12 years old) was recommended this probiotic by my veterinarian after multiple bouts with diarrhea and vomiting. It has been a few months and this product seems to have cured my dog. Amazon has a better price than the vet.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Great Probiotic for Dogs!
customer_reviews.text: Forti Flora is a great probiotic for dogs. My older girl has had bouts of pancreatitis, and since giving her a combination of a fiber supplement and Forti Flora, she has been very healthy! It keeps dogs regular, and is much easier to give a dog with bowel problems than canned pumpkin (which my dogs do not like).
customer_reviews.author: Nola Gal 2

customer_reviews.title: because I love my dogs
customer_reviews.text: started my new puppy on this and now even my older dog. My vet attended a conference and said pro-biotics aren't just beneficial to sick pets but when used on a regular basis they are like and added benefit, sort of like taking a multi vitamin.. I won't lie amd say they will keep a pet from ever getting sick, but if they only lend a fraction of health benefits with no negative side effects,.well then why would you not add it to your beloved pets diet?
customer_reviews.author: Diane S

customer_reviews.title: Great help for diarrhea in dogs
customer_reviews.text: This is a great supplement to give your dog every day to help prevent diarrhea as it restores flora in the intestinal tract keeping diarrhea at bay. My vet recommended it to me when my two schnauzers had diarrhea and it helped them along with the antibiotics they were on as well. My vet says its fine to give everyday. Sort of like people eating yogurt....fortiflora works the same in dogs and it also comes for cats as well. Much cheaper to buy on Amazon than from the Vets office!!!
customer_reviews.author: Flower Goddess

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected
customer_reviews.text: Seemed to improve bowel movements to nicely formed poops from soft foul smelling
customer_reviews.author: Julia and Chris

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: FortiFlora is a pro-biotic. My dog's intestinal balance was all off from having take a huge amount of antibiotics without the addition of this pro-biotic. It took some time of daily treatment, but it's worked wonders. I am keeping her on it daily, and have been assured by the vet that it's OK to do that. She also treats her dogs daily with this product. Buying the 3 pack saved me money, and the package actually arrived about 3 days early. Great service!
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Expiring date is the main issue.
customer_reviews.text: Product is great but all the 6 box are expiring in December 2019 which sucks. Now I have to feed all of it in 6 months of time
customer_reviews.author: Monica Rajat

customer_reviews.title: PURINA FORTI-FLORA CONTINUES TO GET MY VOTE!!
customer_reviews.text: I've been giving this to my Labradoodle for 6 mos. and it has helped to relieve the digestive/intestinal upsets he was prone to. Easy to give, mixed in with food, he loves it and looks forward to it. UPDATE 08/23/15.... I have now been giving this to my dog for 2yrs, and it has continued to benefit his digestive system. Such a simple thing, with such far-reaching results!! It will certainly continue to be a part of his regimen.
customer_reviews.author: Gini Lisanti

customer_reviews.title: Great PRICE!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for one of my Chihuahuas that appears to have colitis and often has very soft/fatty stools. She is only 9lbs and I give her half a packet every night with her dinner and she eats it up. Her bowel movements have been much harder and consistent since we started using this product. At my vet I was paying $30 for just a box, so this price is also a great price seeing that we use the product every day. I also got the order within three days.
customer_reviews.author: Lex S

customer_reviews.title: A must have for my dog
customer_reviews.text: My husky has have very soft stool from birth to now 3 years later. I've tried everything possible. Vet pills, yogurt, grain free food, raw meat, etc. But this pro-biotic works the best. Just shake the contents into his food every other day and no more scraping up splatter off the floor. He actually loves the taste too and sometimes won't eat his food without this powder. My vet recommended it but it's cheaper here on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: CKH

customer_reviews.title: Helps digestion in senior dog
customer_reviews.text: We were recommended this by our vet and my dog seems to like it. Smells like chicken bouillon to me. I sprinkle half packet on her dry food each meal twice a day. She is in kidney failure so this and a few other OTC items have really been helping her stomach stay settled.
customer_reviews.author: Paula B

customer_reviews.title: Healty dogs
customer_reviews.text: Seems to help all my dogs, my Vet suggested to me, because one of my dogs have stomach problems and lots of gas, it has helped.
customer_reviews.author: Gloria J. Chambers

customer_reviews.title: not truly sure if this product is any good..
customer_reviews.text: seem to help my 4 legged 15 year old furry friend with his IBS. I question the viability of it being a true probiotic as Ermie still has loose bowel movements.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Henick

customer_reviews.title: This is such a small investment for happy girls. I will be sprinkling FortiFlora on their ...
customer_reviews.text: Being the owner of 2 "Golden Girls" ages 10 & 12, their stomachs have become sensitive as they've aged. Upon Veterinary recommendation, we tried FortiFlora and it has cleared up issues almost overnight. This is such a small investment for happy girls. I will be sprinkling FortiFlora on their food every morning for as long as they grace our presence.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great Value Belly Protector that Tastes Good Too!
customer_reviews.text: Fortiflora added to our pets morning meal and this product works wonderfully in protecting his belly while he eats every bit so it must be really tasty too!
customer_reviews.author: AMSCM

customer_reviews.title: My dog had a splenectomy several months ago and picked up some sort of GI infection that was almost Parvo like; bloody diarrhea
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product at the instruction of my veterinarian. My dog had a splenectomy several months ago and picked up some sort of GI infection that was almost Parvo like; bloody diarrhea, vomiting, zero appetite for several days, etc. My vet insisted he be placed on a probiotic as the spleen is part of the immune system. My biggest worry was that he would have side effects since he is so sensitive. He has been on this for a couple months now and he showed no side effects from this at all, and has developed a very healthy appetite again. He hasn't had any diarrhea since starting on it and seems healthy- at the age of 11!
customer_reviews.author: Jodi S

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: Use it for my Golden Retriever who has a sensitive stomach. It helped in stopping the frequent diarrhea and throwing up. My one concern is the price keeps going up!
customer_reviews.author: LM

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommend this if your dog has a sensitive digestive system
customer_reviews.text: Our lab has a sensitive stomach and threw up quite often. If she ate almost anything other than her normal diet--i.e. if she ever got into the trash--she would get sick. She would get sick many other times (eating grass??). I suggested to her vet that she take probiotics, and the vet, who was thinking of giving her Pepsid after the fact thought it worth a try. Our lab does NOT throw up when she takes this once a day. No more vomit to clean up in the mornings! I highly recommend this if your dog has a sensitive digestive system.
customer_reviews.author: Mommy With a Mission

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: My bouvier has had stomach troubles off and on and a couple trips to emergency. Since I've been giving him this, no more throwing up or bloating. He's been on it for almost two months and I give him a packet in his foot every morning. I wonder why this product has increased by $15, for the 90 count, over the price only three months ago?
customer_reviews.author: Thinner

customer_reviews.title: Must have for stinky dogs...  :)
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised... my aging 14 yr old lab was SKINKY! After giving her this for a few days, the stench we had put up for YEARS was practically eliminated overnight! I was so shocked. I would highly recommend this. This was originally recommended from our vet and was very expensive ($1/packet), but amazon is a much better price. It's a must have for dogs with sensitive stomachs or those that require you to invest in gas masks. :)
customer_reviews.author: DR

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: Helped my one dogs sensitive stomach and form his 💩
customer_reviews.author: Sherri baby

customer_reviews.title: Helped with my dog's odor problem
customer_reviews.text: This seems to be a high-quality probiotic. I started giving it to my Australian shepherd after he started developing a "doggie" smell. The smell has since gone away. He gets it almost every day.
customer_reviews.author: AJP

customer_reviews.title: Fortiflora an Effective Canine Dietary Supplement
customer_reviews.text: We started using this at the recommendation of our veterinarian for a young show dog that had exhibited some finickiness in his eating, especially when he was away from home with his handler, as well as occasional digestive issues. We used this with great success as a substitute for a probiotic we had been using. It comes in a powder form that we sprinkle on the dog's food once a day. The dog loves it, even licking it up from the bottom of his food dish, and it has contributed to his being a more enthusiastic eater, and has reduced the frequency of his digestive issues
customer_reviews.author: R. Peter Wolf

customer_reviews.title: Better Regulated, More Energetic Dog!
customer_reviews.text: We put our 8 year old Basset Hound on a dailyregimen of Forti Flora after a week long stay in the kennel left him with severe diarrhea.. With good food (Iams for older dogs), strict portion control, and this supplement, we've seen a dramatic difference in his energy level, along with healthy, regular stool output and stable weight control. Dry Yougurt for dogs. . . it works! Absolutely buy it on line through Amazon or one of their sponsored vendors. The local vet gouges everyone for it at $32 per box--that's over a dollar a day--we got it on line in a bundle of 3 for half the cost per box.
customer_reviews.author: Ava

customer_reviews.title: Not a cure for my dog. No issues with the product.
customer_reviews.text: My dog has a sensitive stomach. Having read all the five star reviews, I decided to see if this would help his tummy. I saw no appreciable difference. He likes the taste, no problems with him yumming it up, just not a cure for the tummy. So, I switched to Wellness Simple, which has probiotics. That seems to be the answer
customer_reviews.author: HomerTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Veterinary Recommended this product for our dogs , helps a lot so far no side effects
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Ann

customer_reviews.title: Helped my dog with colitis
customer_reviews.text: My mix breed dog has really bad colitis. We've been to a number of vets, he's been on special food, and taken a lot of medicine over the past 4 years. Somehow I stumbled onto an online site that mentioned probiotics for dogs, so I gave it a try. It's been over 2 months since his last (sorry for the bluntness!) bloody stool and his energy level and overall mood have been great. I'm hoping for long term relief from the cycle of GI issues with daily usage of the FortaFlora.
customer_reviews.author: borderblend

customer_reviews.title: Great service & fast delivery from the seller, great product
customer_reviews.text: I ordered on Friday, the product arrived on Monday, faster than advertised. And for our dog, it is perfect. All of her digestive problems have disappeared. The poops are solid, not loose and easy to pick up. We have been using daily, and have transitioned to every other day, which seems to work as well. I highly recommend FortiFlora, which we learned of from our vet.
customer_reviews.author: E. Harris

customer_reviews.title: I told my dog handler/breeder friends and we all love it! I now give this to my two ...
customer_reviews.text: My vet gave me these when my dog was sick. She did really well and recovered quickly. I told my dog handler/breeder friends and we all love it! I now give this to my two dogs and they have not had any digestive problems! Very handy to take with you when you pack for a trip! I buy these on a regular basis and so do my friends.
customer_reviews.author: Golden Hands

customer_reviews.title: Great for my dogs stomach issues.
customer_reviews.text: My dog has Crohn's disease, and this powder once a day has noticibly improved his bowels. His appetite has increased, and he has much less gas and diarrhea. He still has occasional bouts of stomach issues, but they are less severe and shorter. We sprinkle the powder on his dog food once a day.
customer_reviews.author: cassiej0

customer_reviews.title: I love this and so does my boy
customer_reviews.text: This not only is a great probiotic for my boy's good health, but he loves the taste. Since I only feed him all natural dry food that doesn't have propylene glycol (anti freeze) added to sweeten it. At times when he decides to be picky and not eat his dry dog food, I just have to sprinkle half of a packet onto it and he eats it immediately!
customer_reviews.author: Bunnie

customer_reviews.title: Constant diarrhea no more!
customer_reviews.text: My Labrador retriever used to have diarrhea every week. We were at the vet constantly. We were buying this $65 gentle food for their intestines that you can only find at vets. I went online to see if I could find a better solution and this came up. Now we feed her one packet of the Fortiflora a day with Iams sensitive stomach. She hasn't had an episode in 6 months.
customer_reviews.author: V. Dickson

customer_reviews.title: Good price on a healthful product
customer_reviews.text: This 3-pack is a good deal. My cats gets a pack a day, so she goes through it. If you are feeding your cat a food supplemented with taurine, you can use the canine formula (which does not have taurine added like the cat formula does. Otherwise the two are the same.) Also, if your pet is going to have to take antibiotics - get them going on this just like humans should start yogurt b/4 antibiotics. It can really help with sick tummies and diarrhea.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy W

customer_reviews.title: Great for your dog
customer_reviews.text: Dog was having stomach issues. So the vet said to give him this for the rest of his life. OK with me!
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Brown

customer_reviews.title: they have been doing much better. Now in combination with a low fat prescription ...
customer_reviews.text: Two of my elder minpins have a tendency for pancreatitis. Since using FortiFlora, suggested by my vet, they have been doing much better. Now in combination with a low fat prescription food, they are back to their regular minpins selves!
customer_reviews.author: Loretta Billingsley

customer_reviews.title: Purina Fortiflora
customer_reviews.text: i highly RECOMMEND THIS PRODUCT FOR YOUR PUP IF THEY ARE HAVING ANY DIGESTIVE, BOWEL OR STOMACH problems - It is expensive, but the science is behind itj
customer_reviews.author: Linda F.

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: Definetely stopped loose stools. Highly recommended for this purpose. Will continue to use. 1st recommended by my vet, but a bit too pricey to buy that way. this product ok and came on time. the product I had ordered before, Williams and Sonoma peppermint bark came stale and moldy and had to throw it all out. that was 2 metal boxes.
customer_reviews.author: debby

customer_reviews.title: Best for Canine IBD
customer_reviews.text: Before jumping into prescription food from the vet, my vet suggested we try this probiotic for my dog's first colitis attach and ongoing sensitive stomach. It worked. He was back to normal in a three days. It is now part of his daily maintenance and he is doing wonderfully. We watch him carefully looking for side effects and the like. After 3 months, there isn't any negative side effects. Strongly recommend trying this product first.
customer_reviews.author: Molly

customer_reviews.title: Helps My Dogs Digestion
customer_reviews.text: We have had a couple of Golden Retrievers with sensitive digestive tracks. Fortiflora really helps the dogs.
customer_reviews.author: D. Porter

customer_reviews.title: Helped my dog with his GI problems.
customer_reviews.text: When my dog had a bad bout of diarrhea, I gave him 1 packet Fortiflora per day for 2 weeks and it cleared up the diarrhea quite quickly. Since then, I have been giving him 1 packet a week to maintain good GI health. I saved a lot of money by ordering through Amazon rather than purchase through my vet who wanted $40 per box of 30 packets. Will order again when I run out.
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I live in LA and my dog eats a lot of stuff off the street that i try to forget when she licks me. This stuff was first given to me by my vet and cleared up her runny stools after a day - I've tried some of the cheaper brands and they don't seem to do anything at all.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Lipman

customer_reviews.title: Worked well for my Lab.
customer_reviews.text: Fortiflora was recommended by my Veterinarian for my Lab when he was having some digestive issues. It worked fast and he likes how it tastes.
customer_reviews.author: P. Bucy

customer_reviews.title: This is great for my dog but he does not like the ...
customer_reviews.text: This is great for my dog but he does not like the taste, so I have to mix it separately with some moist food (canned food) instead of putting it in his dry food. Also, on the site of fortiflora, you can download and fill out a rebate form (amount: 5 $) for either canine or feline fortiflora. I received my check last week.
customer_reviews.author: BL

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: My 13 yr old dog began having a very sensitive stomach about 6 months ago. He'd get severe diarrhea. His vet provided Purina Fortiflora for me to sprinkle in his dinner along with a low-fat diet for 30 days. We went thru this 3 times, it kept coming back. After this last time we decided to keep him on the Fortiflora indefinitely. To date, he's had no more issues.
customer_reviews.author: JFC

customer_reviews.title: FortiFlora
customer_reviews.text: We are NEVER without this product on our shelf. Our dog is prone to colitis and as long as she gets one packet of this product sprinkled on her food each morning she stays healthy. She has not had a bout of her illness since we started her on this supplement. Prior to that she was sick and at the vet far too often. We buy three boxes at a time...which lasts 3 months.
customer_reviews.author: Sophie and Edi

product_meta.title: Purina Fortiflora Canine Nutritional Supplement Box (3 Pack), 30gm/90 Count
product_meta.description: Purina FortiFlora Canine Nutritional Supplement contains the beneficial microorganisms found naturally in your dog's digestive system to help manage and shorten episodes of diarrhea. Common causes of diarrhea for dogs and puppies include food changes, antibiotic therapy and environmental stress.
feature_bullets: Contains high levels of antioxidants, vitamins A, E, and C
Contains a guaranteed amount of live active cultures
